file_content.text: It'll take months for the Gormak to restart armor production--long enough to hit them where it hurts. Take care.
So? How did it go? At least that brute Shakval didn't get hold of you.
We crossed paths. Now he is one with the Force.
Shakval is dead.
We crossed paths. Now the Gormak need somewhere to bury him.
Shakval's dead.
Wait. You're serious? And you found time to destroy the armor tech, too?
The Three will smile.
I'll say! No armor, and Shakval dead... the Gormak will be running in circles. Thank you. You saved a lot of lives today.
It was tough, but I coped.
All finished.
I think I'm done helping you.
Sorry. I did think about coming after you, but... well, I'd just have got in your way.
That armor was the Gormak's biggest advantage. You know, you probably saved a few hundred Voss lives today.
For you. In thanks. I will tell the Three of this. Go well.
Just find the camp and break anything that looks like it powers that armor. And watch your back.
That island's isolated, fortified... the Gormak keep a garrison of those cyber-beasts there. Good place for building this armor.
You can catch them off guard.
What happens now?
But I've done my part.
No time to get help. Armor tech must be destroyed. You should go.
He means, we appreciate what you've done. But we need that camp taken apart--the tech powering the armor, and whatever else they're cooking up. Anything you can do?
I'm sure I can be of use.
Yes, but I won't go in blind.
We saw a village and some manufacturing equipment, but we couldn't get too close.
Persuade me. Money works fine.
That's fair. We owe you for the armor pieces, anyway.
Should know. Shakval was sighted near the islands. Gormak mechanist. Could be involved.
Reek's teeth, that's right. And Shakval's a terror; practically an army by himself. Maybe we should wait for help after all.
Don't worry, I'll be careful.
If I'm fast, I might be okay.
I can handle him.
Well, okay. Remember, destroying the armor tech is the priority. Don't go looking for trouble.
We wait for you.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
Fair enough--you already did us a big favor.
Here. This is for getting us the armor. Suppose the rest is up to us.
Sheesh. We could hear the fighting from here; any luck with the armor?
Well, look at that. The energy readings on the armor match ones we got from a Gormak camp, out on the islands.
Please, bring us all the armor you can find. The more readings we get, the better.
Shh. Do us a favor, don't kick any stones over the side.
You seen that little Gormak village down there? Looks quiet, but fish aren't the only thing they're shipping out.
Gormak armor. Powerful. Smuggled to village. Then sent elsewhere.
The Gormak might be preparing a major offensive against you.
Maybe they have battle plans.
Considered. Republic offered to investigate. Helpful.
It would be faster to just move the armor openly rather than smuggling it.
Why the secrecy, I wonder.
Voss commandos watch. Gormak know. They fear us.
I've seen the Gormak take shots that would floor an Imperial soldier.
That armor is impressive.
And wouldn't it be nice if that kind of tech was on our side?
Smuggling? I'm innocent!
Relax. What you do with your ship is your business. These Gormak aren't looking to get outsiders' attention.
What makes the armor special?
That village? Seriously?
We watched. Listened. We know.
The Gormak can energize their armor somehow, make it extra strong. We've been trying to track it to the source and find out how.
Crates in the village. Armor pieces inside. Answers.
Right. Those armor scraps might give the readings we need. But I'm no fighter, and the Gormak will tear Abdan here apart if we get too close. It's tricky.
Perhaps I can do something.
Not for someone like me.
Now that's an idea. The Gormak are probably wise to us, but not to you.
To village. Find crates; bring armor to us.
And come back in one piece, okay?
Sure. I just hope that armor doesn't get too far before we come up with a plan.
Don't give our position away, would you?
You're useless. I'll do it.
